info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 5:01PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Yellowstone County through 530 PM MDT... At 501 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 16 miles northwest of Billings Heights, or 18 miles northwest of Billings, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Billings, Shepherd, Billings West End, Acton and Comanche. This advisory does not include the city of Billings. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
